exhibit.title: Biography by Denise Vultee with the Editors

image.caption: Engraving, c. 1826-27. Essick Collection.

image.caption: Engraving, 1793. The British Museum.

image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Jean-Antoine Watteau, 1782. Essick Collection.

image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Jean-Antoine Watteau, 1782. Essick Collection.

image.title: Don Quixote
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Thomas Stothard for The Novelist's Magazine, 1782. Essick Collection.

image.title: Clarence’s Dream
image.caption: An illustration to Shakespeare’s Richard III. Engraved by Blake after Thomas Stothard for William Enfield, The Speaker, 1780. Essick Collection.

image.title: Introduction to Mensuration
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Thomas Stothard for John Bonnycastle, An Introduction to Mensuration, 1782. Second state, 1787. Essick Collection.

image.title: Homer Invoking the Muse
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after John Flaxman for Flaxman, The Iliad of Homer, 1805. Essick Collection.

image.title: Iron Age
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after George Cumberland for Cumberland, Thoughts on Outline, 1796. Essick Collection.

image.title: Academy Study: A Naked Youth Seen from the Side, Perhaps Robert Blake
image.caption: Black chalk, c. 1779-80. The British Museum.

image.title: Academy Study: Standing Male Nude Seen from Behind
image.caption: Pencil, c. 1779-80. The British Museum.

image.title: The Death of Earl Goodwin
image.caption: Water color, c. 1779. The British Museum.

image.title: The Making of Magna Charta
image.caption: Water color, c. 1779. Essick Collection.

image.title: War Unchained by an Angel, Fire, Pestilence, and Famine Following

image.caption: Holograph manuscript by Blake, page 8, c. 1784. The Fitzwilliam Museum.

image.title: Zephyrus and Flora
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Thomas Stothard, 1784. Essick Collection.

image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Thomas Stothard, 1784. Essick Collection.

image.title: Beggar’s Opera, Act III
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after William Hogarth for The Original Works of William Hogarth, 1790. Essick Collection.

image.title: All Religions are One, copy A, plate 2 (title page)
image.caption: Relief etching with pen and ink additions. Etched c. 1788, printed 1795. The Huntington Library.

image.title: There is No Natural Religion, copy G, plate a2 (title page)
image.caption: Relief etching with rudimentary color printing. Etched c. 1788, printed 1794. The Pierpont Morgan Library.

image.title: Aphorisms on Man
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Henry Fuseli for John Caspar Lavater, Aphorisms on Man, 1788. Essick Collection.

image.title: Songs of Innocence, copy B, plate 2 (title page)
image.caption: Relief and white-line etching with hand coloring, 1789. Rosenwald Collection, The Library of Congress.

image.caption: Relief etching with hand coloring. Etched 1789, printed c. 1818. Rosenwald Collection, The Library of Congress.

image.title: The Marriage of Heaven and Hell, copy I, plate 1 (title page)
image.caption: Relief and white-line etching with hand coloring. Etched 1790, printed 1827. The Fitzwilliam Museum.

image.title: Tiriel Supporting the Dying Myratana and Cursing His Sons
image.caption: An illustration to Blake’s poem, Tiriel. Monochrome wash drawing, c. 1789. Yale Center for British Art.

image.title: Har Blessing Tiriel While Mnetha Comforts Heva
image.caption: An illustration to Blake’s poem, Tiriel. Monochrome wash drawing, c. 1789. The British Museum.

image.title: America a Prophecy, copy O, plate 2 (title page)
image.caption: Relief and white-line etching with hand coloring. Etched 1793, printed 1821. The Fitzwilliam Museum.

image.caption: Relief and white-line etching with hand coloring. Etched 1794, printed 1821. The Fitzwilliam Museum.

image.title: Battle of the Centaurs and Lapithae
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after William Pars for James Stuart and Nicholas Revett, The Antiquities of Athens, vol. 3 (1794). Essick Collection.

image.title: Fertilization of Egypt
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Henry Fuseli for Erasmus Darwin, The Botanic Garden, 1791. Essick Collection.

image.title: Tornado
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after Henry Fuseli for Erasmus Darwin, The Botanic Garden, 3rd ed., 1795. Essick Collection.

image.title: A Negro hung alive by the Ribs to a Gallows
image.caption: Engraved by Blake after John Gabriel Stedman for Stedman, Narrative, of a Five Years’ Expedition, Against the Revolted Negroes of Surinam, 1796. Essick Collection.

image.title: Flagellation of a Female Samboe Slave

image.caption: Engraved by Blake after John Gabriel Stedman for Stedman, Narrative, of a Five Years’ Expedition, Against the Revolted Negroes of Surinam, 1796. Essick Collection.

image.title: Look what a fine morning it is
image.caption: Designed and engraved by Blake as the frontispiece for Mary Wollstonecraft, Original Stories from Real Life, 1791. Essick Collection.

image.caption: Engraved by Blake after a medallion by John Flaxman for William Hayley, An Essay on Sculpture, 1800. Essick Collection.

image.title: Merlin, a Visionary Head

image.title: Ghost of a Flea, Reverse of the coin of Nebuchadnezzar, and Taurus
image.caption: Engraved by John Linnell after Blake (Ghost of a Flea and Reverse of the coin of Nebuchadnezzar) and John Varley (Taurus) for Varley, A Treatise on Zodiacal Physiognomy, 1828. Essick Collection.
